briefdescription.para: Keeps track of whether or not to udpate the view matrix.
Keeps track of whether or not to udpate the projection matrix.
Is used to update camera vectors etc.

detaileddescription.para:
The user has to override this function for the camera to work like intended.
The function will be called every tick.

simplesect.para: Returns the camera's front vector / viewing direction.

briefdescription.para: Is used to change the camera's position.
Is used to set a size for the camera that fits the viewport dimensions.
Is used to set the camera's field of view.
Is used to set the mouse sensitivity.
Re-calculates the camera's view matrix as well as the inversed view matrix.
Re-calculates the camera's projection matrix as well as the inversed projection matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The difference of the current offset on the x-axis and the previous offset.
The difference of the current offset on the y-axis and the previous offset.

briefdescription.para: Used to handle user-defined keyboard inputs or input events.

detaileddescription.para:
This function is called inside update() and followed up by a call to updateViewMatrix() and does not have to be called by the user.
Implementation of this function should be inside a user-defined inherited class.

simplesect.para: Only needs to be called if mouse was moved.

detaileddescription.para: This class acts like an interface for the user by providing the most important camera-related matrices as well as the camera's position, which are required by the rendering API.

simplesect.para: The user has to handle keyboard related camera changes inside update().
Do not forget to re-calculate the view or projection matrix if the camera or the window have changed. See updateViewMatrix(), updateProjectionMatrix() or updateView and updateProj respectively.
